Even though this game is 13 years old (as of 2020) it still brings me happiness and satisfaction while playing TF2. Definitely a game that is fun for any First-Person-Shooter fan at any skill level.

After playing this game for 700+ hours, here's what I have to say about the game.

The GOOD!

- There is so much content to this game. There's over 100 maps, 14 game-modes, an endless amount of community servers, over 100 weapons.

- The original art-style is fantastic and classic. Each character and location are extremely distinct and memorable. Over the years, 
the art-style has gotten less consistent due to some bizarre cosmetics, but if you ignore those, it's great.

- The game-play is addictive and rewarding. Most of the gun-play is all about precision and timing. Most of the guns feel great, being single fire and high damage. And with nine classes to choose from, finding a character that fits you is easy. Like taking it long range? Consider picking Sniper. Want to go fast? Pick the Scout. Want to play defensive? Pick the engineer, and so on.

- Expressing yourself is easier and more innovative than before, as you have the ability to purchase a variety of cosmetics, ranging from beanies, to suits, to even extra eyeballs. Don't feel like spending a dime? The massive amount of achievements in this game will allow you to unlock a ton of free hats. Though, the quality of those hats range.


The BAD.

- As of 3/28/2022, there is a MASSIVE bot problem in this game. It has been going on since 2020, and has only gotten worse. They spam awful things through text chat and voice chat. They only appear in casual mode, so I recommend you play on community servers. 

- This game is greedy. It desperately wants you to buy something. Literately anything. It is foaming at the mouth for your money. If you do not pay a five dollar fee, your inventory space will be incredibly small, you will not be able to type or speak into text chat or voice chat, and a variety of other features will be completely blocked off from you, such as competitive.

- This game will never get a major update ever again. There will never be any balance changes, nor will there be any new weapons. Every single update since 2017 has added only cosmetic items, such as weapon skins, hats, and clothes.

- A large amount of weapons are just completely useless. They serve such a specific and situational purpose, so much so that you will realistically never accomplish anything significant with them. 

The CONCLUSION...
Should you play this game? 
Yeah, sure. It's a pretty great game, despite the many flaws it faces. 
And I know I seem harsh on this game, but that's because I love it.
So download it today if you want to, and take down that red spy in the base!
tf2 is a classic, other than aim botters and other cheaters, i would recommend this game :)

If you like chaotic first person shooter games, you should definitely give it a try. The gameplay is fun, the community is friendly (the most of it) and you can customize almost everything of the 9 available characters

I used to like this game, until I replayed it recently. Most, if not all matchmaking servers are filled with Waffen and shoppy bots, making it a chore to find a fair game. The Competitive mode is horrendously terrible. I do not think I should've invested over 1,000 hours into this game. The community is also very toxic to the point that I mistake this for an MHA fanbase.
